name: North Island Kiwi
description: The North Island Kiwi is a small, flightless bird with a long beak, known for its nocturnal habits.
spread_note: Native to New Zealandâ€™s North Island.
food_note: Forages at night using its keen sense of smell.
reproduction: Lays 1-2 large eggs in a burrow, incubation about 70-80 days.
attractions: Rare in zoos due to specific needs, but iconic for New Zealand.
projects_note: Endangered; conservation focuses on predator control and breeding.
breeding: Bred in captivity to boost wild populations.
